races.nyt_race_description: Michigan had been reliably blue in choosing a president for nearly 25 years, until 2016, when Donald Trump won the state by the smallest margin in the country â€“ 10,704 votes. But Joseph R. Biden Jr. has seen consistent leads in virtually all the polls leading up to Election Day.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Joe Bidenâ€™s victory was particularly sweet for supporters in three states he had to win: Pennsylvania, Wisconsin and Michigan.

liveUpdates.author: Dionne Searcey
liveUpdates.text: In rural Nebraska, a Biden win drew a big, red-state shrug. Many Republicans said they planned to show liberals that it was possible to simply move on when you lose.

liveUpdates.author: Astead Herndon
liveUpdates.text: After tough losses in the House for Democrats, Conor Lamb, a moderate, says heâ€™s â€œfrustratedâ€ by progressive rhetoric and policy proposals.

liveUpdates.author: Matt Stevens
liveUpdates.text: The Trump campaign announced that Representative Doug Collins, a staunch Trump ally who failed in his recent bid for a Senate seat, would lead its recount team in Georgia, where Trump trails by about 10,000 votes.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Trump continues to narrow the gap in Arizona, where he now trails by just 0.51 points. But he still isnâ€™t doing well enough to overtake Biden â€” and the number of remaining mail and provisional ballots is dwindling.

liveUpdates.author: Eric Lipton
liveUpdates.text: I ran into random federal employees I know. From various agencies. Again and again, they expressed enormous relief. A storm cloud is passing. Work of the government can continue.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Assuming Trump keeps doing rallies, which seems a good assumption, I wonder how theyâ€™ll be financed? It's doubtful heâ€™d pay for them himself. These things are not inexpensive.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Grynbaum
liveUpdates.text: Fox Newsâ€™s audience plummeted yesterday after Biden became president-elect.  During the Biden/Harris speeches, Fox had 3 million viewers, the lowest total of any network.

liveUpdates.author: Sabrina Tavernise
liveUpdates.text: How the summer of protests played out at the polls: About nine of every 10 voters said the protests over police violence were important, but for very different reasons.

liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters
liveUpdates.text: Prominent Republicans are continuing to close ranks around President Trump, with Senator Ted Cruz of Texas saying that he still believed the president had â€œa path to victory.â€

liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters
liveUpdates.text: From midnight until noon, the Trump campaign sent out a flurry of solicitations to supporters asking for money to fund its legal battles â€” at the rate of almost one every hour.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: The new county with the longest streak of picking presidential winners is Clallam County, Wash., population 77,000, which has gotten every election right since 1980.

liveUpdates.author: Matt Flegenheimer
liveUpdates.text: People have not historically hustled to spontaneous outdoor dance parties for Joe Biden. But beating President Trump can do strange things for a manâ€™s reputation.
Abigail Spanberger, Democrat, wins re-election in Virginiaâ€™s Seventh Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Eric Schmitt
liveUpdates.text: Former Secretary of State Colin L. Powell, in a telephone interview: â€œJoe Biden brings back the American way of doing things. Heâ€™ll return us to who we are.â€

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Haberman
liveUpdates.text: A White House official disputed reports that Jared Kushner had advised Trump to concede the election, saying Kushner was telling him to pursue â€œlegal remediesâ€ instead.

liveUpdates.author: Peter Baker
liveUpdates.text: George W. Bush congratulates Biden on his victory: â€œThough we have political differences, I know Joe Biden to be a good man, who has won his opportunity to lead and unify our country.â€

liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold
liveUpdates.text: Congressâ€™s inauguration committee is planning for an â€œoutside, full-scaleâ€ event despite the pandemic, though it could be scaled back, the senator who chairs it said.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: Biden has returned home from church and his team has called a lid, meaning he is not expected to appear in person again today.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: As Bidenâ€™s lead increases in Georgia, the remaining votes are coming from about 22,000 military and overseas voters, as well as provisional ballots that required additional information, such as missing IDs.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Biden is spending this Sunday morning, like most Sunday mornings, in church. He is set to be the nationâ€™s second Catholic president.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Even though President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. now leads by more than 10,000 votes in Georgia, a recount is still expected there.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: With the votes still being tallied in Georgia, a once-red state that proved surprisingly difficult for Trump, Biden now leads by more than 10,000 votes.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: On the morning of his first full day as president-elect, Joe Biden is now at church near his home in Delaware.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: The race may be called, but Philadelphia votes are continuing to build on Bidenâ€™s margin. Nearly 90 percent of a recent batch of votes went to Biden, adding 3,868 to his margin.

liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear
liveUpdates.text: Trump was greeted at his golf course by a small handful of people, including two holding Trump 2020 signs. But another sign said, â€œOrange Crushed.â€

liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear
liveUpdates.text: Trump has arrived again at Trump National Golf Club in Virginia, even as he and his allies refuse to concede his loss and as Biden moves ahead with building his new administration.

liveUpdates.author: Luke Broadwater
liveUpdates.text: Two runoff elections in Georgia set for early January will almost certainly determine which party has control of the Senate.

liveUpdates.author: Sydney Ember
liveUpdates.text: President-elect Biden has shifted leftward since the primary, but he has hardly embraced the bold agenda of progressives.

liveUpdates.author: Mark Landler
liveUpdates.text: Next up: the scramble by foreign leaders to reach President-elect Biden with congratulatory phone calls. A lot of diplomatic prestige rides on getting in early.

liveUpdates.author: Richard Fausset
liveUpdates.text: Biden is on the verge of adding Georgia to his winning electoral margin, with a narrow lead that is headed for a recount but is nevertheless a dramatic sign of the shifting politics of the South.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: â€œLet this grim era of demonization in America begin to end here and now.â€ In his first speech as president-elect, Joe Biden stresses unity.

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: Thereâ€™s no evidence to support claims by Trump and his supporters that election observers were blocked from counting rooms.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: As Trump refused to concede defeat on Saturday, top Republican congressional leaders followed suit, refraining from releasing the customary statements of congratulations.

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: Trumpâ€™s already daunting odds for a change in the election result appeared to be dimming even further in key states in the ongoing vote counting on Saturday.

liveUpdates.author: Sarah Mervosh
liveUpdates.text: For years, the battle for president has been waged in Ohio, a bellwether state that had predicted the outcome of every presidential election since 1964. Not this time.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Joe Bidenâ€™s victory speech set a tone that was very different from President Trumpâ€™s, invoking his own spirituality and sharing credit with others.

liveUpdates.author: Matt Stevens
liveUpdates.text: Joe Biden had to flip a few states that went to President Trump in 2016 and hold on to Democratic-leaning battleground states to win the election.

liveUpdates.author: Shawn Hubler
liveUpdates.text: In Democrat-dominated California, the ascension of Kamala Harris put renewed focus on contenders for the vice president-electâ€™s soon-to-be vacant Senate seat.

liveUpdates.author: Matt Stevens
liveUpdates.text: In his victory speech, President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. renewed his promise to be a president for all Americans in a polarized time.

liveUpdates.author: Matt Stevens
liveUpdates.text: In her remarks, Vice President-elect Kamala Harris acknowledged â€œall the women who have worked to secure and protect the right to voteâ€ and said: â€œAnd I stand on their shoulders.â€

liveUpdates.author: Astead Herndon
liveUpdates.text: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez on the Biden transition and the left: It will â€œindicate whether the administration is taking a more open and collaborative approachâ€ or an â€œicing-out approach.â€

liveUpdates.author: Alex Burns
liveUpdates.text: Biden told a close ally two winters ago that he feared for the countryâ€™s soul. Top Dems feared that message would flop. But Biden trusted his instincts.

liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters
liveUpdates.text: For four years, whether people liked Trump or not, almost everyone I interviewed said they were exhausted. This is the first time in a long time when people en masse expressed relief.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Trumpâ€™s 2017 inaugural: â€œThis American carnage stops right here and stops right now.â€ Biden tonight: â€œThis is the time to heal in America.â€

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: The look on Joe Bidenâ€™s face watching those fireworks is definitely the look of a guy who got a job he wanted for at least 33 years. Maybe longer.

liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush
liveUpdates.text: Saturdayâ€™s split screen: Trump alone on a golf course; Biden surrounded by his family under fireworks.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Iâ€™m guessing, watching this high-tech fireworks and drone finale, that the Biden campaign ended up with a fair amount of money in the bank.

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: Wilmington gets its moment at long last.

liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush
liveUpdates.text: After months of stilted, socially distanced and â€œdrive-inâ€ events, the Biden and Harris families â€” mostly masked â€” are allowing themselves one normal, exultant moment together onstage.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Biden and his family get confetti and fireworks.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Assume the strategy from here on out is: This train is leaving the station, and a transition is taking place. Take the focus away from Trump and push the country into a new era.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: The song â€œHigher Love,â€ which is something of an anthem for Biden staffers, just finished playing. I imagine there was a lot of jubilation in that moment.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: This is a moving-on speech. The election is over; heâ€™s reaching out to Trump voters. No need to acknowledge Trumpâ€™s non-concession.

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: Bidenâ€™s recitation of a hymn is a reminder that he does have an abiding faith that his opponents refused to acknowledge throughout the campaign.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: â€œSpread the faith,â€ Biden says, concluding perhaps the biggest speech of his life in the way he typically does.

liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush
liveUpdates.text: Biden made no explicit mention of Trump in his speech â€” nor did he address the issue of Trumpâ€™s refusal to concede defeat.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Biden reading a hymn really nails down that we are at a moment of transition in this nation.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: This is an upbeat, optimistic speech even in the midst of a very dark time in this nation. â€œWe can do it: I know we can,â€ Biden says.

liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush
liveUpdates.text: Biden said his mandate is to find common ground to â€œcooperateâ€ with Republicans, pivoting to the center after embracing the partyâ€™s liberal wing during the general election.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: â€œLet this grim era of demonization in America begin to end, here and now.â€ That feels like the money quote, as we say.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper
liveUpdates.text: â€œOur work begins with getting Covid under control,â€ Biden says, at a moment when the United States is seeing record numbers of new infections.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Big contrast with Trump: Controlling the coronavirus is critical to turning around the economy and getting the nation back on the right track, Biden says.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: A line Biden has been using for a while now but that has particular significance tonight: He says that he has run as a proud Democrat but will govern as an American president.

liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush
liveUpdates.text: In contrast to Trump, whose speeches are paeans of self-praise, Biden is crediting others, and allowed Harris to deliver a powerful speech without apparent concern about being upstaged.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: â€œThis is the time to heal in America.â€ Biden is signaling the big early themes of his presidency. Covid-19. Health care. Racial justice. Climate change.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Biden is reaching out to Trump voters. â€œItâ€™s time to put away the harsh rhetoric.â€

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Biden describes his coalition as broad and diverse and appeals to Trump supporters: â€œLetâ€™s give each other a chance.â€

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: â€œI owe you, I owe you, I owe you everything.â€ In case there was any doubt, Biden is very different than the man he is replacing in the White House.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: â€œAmerica has bent the arc of the moral universe more toward justice.â€ Biden is paraphrasing the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Biden comes right out establishing the legitimacy of his election: "They delivered us a clear victory, a convincing victory.â€ 74 million votes. A record.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Biden is hitting one of the central themes of his candidacy: that the stakes of the election transcended typical partisan divisions.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Biden comes trotting onto the stage. Finally getting a moment he has waited for for decades. And to Bruce Springsteen!

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. has taken the stage, 48 years to the day after he was elected to the U.S. Senate.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Harris: â€œThe road ahead will not be easy.â€ Harris and Biden need to prepare Americans for tough times as the country confronts the pandemic.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper
liveUpdates.text: A century after the passage of the 19th Amendment, Kamala Harris is the vice president-elect, and says that while she may be the first woman to hold the office, she will not be the last.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Harris talks about the â€œaudacityâ€ Biden showed in picking the first woman to be vice president â€” an Obama tribute there.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Harris tips to the historic nature of her election, talking about women and people of color â€œwho throughout our history have paved the way for this moment tonight.â€

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Itâ€™ll be interesting to see how big a role Kamala Harris plays in a Biden White House. There have been a lot of powerful V.P.s in recent years, like Dick Cheney â€” and Joe Biden.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: â€œFor four years you marched and organized for equality and justice, for our lives and for our planets. And then you voted,â€ Harris says. â€œYou chose hope and unity, decency, science, and yes, truth.â€

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Vice President-elect Kamala Harris is onstage in Wilmington.
Darrell Issa, Republican, wins Californiaâ€™s 50th Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Trump concession or not, Biden already appears to have a full-scale, presidential-level Secret Service protection motorcade detail around him.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: Bidenâ€™s motorcade is on its way to the Chase Center in Wilmington, where he will address the nation.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: As Biden supporters await the president-elect in Wilmington, many are waving large American flags and glow sticks.

liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush
liveUpdates.text: Biden has extended his lead in Georgia to 9,160 votes with a net gain of 1,613 votes from DeKalb County. The statewide margin is still well within the range of a recount.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Biden and Harris spoke to campaign staffers tonight, thanking them for their efforts. Biden spoke of the need to engage Trump supporters and other Republicans in an effort to unite the nation and move forward.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Haberman
liveUpdates.text: Aides say itâ€™s not clear that Trump will adhere to customs like inviting Biden to the White House. But Biden, a previous vice president, is not in need of a tour.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: The drive-in rally in honor of Joe Biden in Wilmington is filling up. People are sitting in lawn chairs and on roofs of cars as they wait for him to speak here.

liveUpdates.author: Eric Schmitt
liveUpdates.text: Former Senator Carl Levin, Democrat of Michigan, in a telephone interview: "Itâ€™s thrilling for the country to see a bully removed from office.â€

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: The Trump campaign has filed a lawsuit alleging irregularities in some in-person voting in Maricopa County, Ariz., seeking to delay certification of results pending an investigation.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. is expected to speak tonight from a flag-bedecked outdoor stage near the Chase Center on the Riverfront, an event facility in Wilmington.

liveUpdates.author: Sydney Ember
liveUpdates.text: Progressives are preparing to unleash a campaign to pressure Biden over personnel and priorities, even as they wrestle with the need to be more realistic about expectations.

liveUpdates.author: Matt Flegenheimer
liveUpdates.text: As he prepares to lead a divided Washington, President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. will confront the ultimate test of how much times have changed, and how much he has.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper
liveUpdates.text: A few hours after Rudy Giuliani held a news conference in Philadelphia questioning the results, a small protest against him broke out in New York, the city he once led as mayor.

liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear
liveUpdates.text: The White House declared a â€œlidâ€ at 3:59 p.m., indicating that President Trump has no intentions of appearing in public today to make a statement about his loss. (He could still tweet his feelings at any moment.)

liveUpdates.author: Eric Schmitt
liveUpdates.text: Former Senator Sam Nunn, Democrat of Georgia, in a phone interview about Biden: â€œHe can help heal the country. All of his instincts are to govern from the middle, from the center.â€

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Another thing to watch: Will President Trump start losing followers on Twitter?

liveUpdates.author: Catie Edmondson
liveUpdates.text: Representative Steve Scalise of Louisiana, the No. 2 House Republican, takes a cue from President Trump, saying â€œthe election is not finalâ€ until legal challenges are resolved.

liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear
liveUpdates.text: Trumpâ€™s motorcade arrived back at the White House, having driven past crowds of mostly Biden supporters. Trump waved at reporters as he entered the West Wing side entrance.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: In many ways, he ran as the politician he has always been. And for one extraordinary election, that was enough. After a half-century in public life, Joe Biden is president-elect.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: What to watch: former Republican presidents and candidates validating Bidenâ€™s victory. In particular, George W. Bush. Mitt Romney was quick to do it. Watch for Bob Dole.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Grynbaum
liveUpdates.text: On Fox News, Chris Wallace says the Trump campaign has presented no hard evidence of fraud. He notes that â€œtens of thousands of votesâ€ would have be reversed to change the result.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold
liveUpdates.text: The reaction in America has been â€” predictably, given this election â€” divided. In big cities supporting Biden, celebrations erupted. Trumpâ€™s supporters voiced disappointment and disbelief.

liveUpdates.author: Alan Blinder
liveUpdates.text: Former President Jimmy Carter welcomed Bidenâ€™s election to the White House on Saturday, more than four decades after they first became political allies.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Obama spoke separately today with Biden and Harris, a representative confirms: â€œHe congratulated them on their historic victory and told them how proud he was of the campaign they ran.â€

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Representative Will Hurd, Republican of Texas, who is also retiring: â€œItâ€™s time to come together. America has spoken and we must respect the decision.â€

liveUpdates.author: Catie Edmondson
liveUpdates.text: Some Trump allies in the House have adopted his rhetoric: â€œIt would be unwise to accept any outcomeâ€ before recounts and court reviews, said Rep. Jodey Arrington of Texas.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Senator Lamar Alexander, Republican of Tennessee, whoâ€™s retiring: â€œAfter counting every valid vote and allowing courts to resolve disputes, it is important to respect and promptly accept the result.â€

liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush
liveUpdates.text: Senator Mitt Romney, the 2012 Republican nominee, is not waiting for Trump to concede. Heâ€™s congratulated Biden and Harris and praised them â€œas people of good will and admirable character.â€

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Schumer, celebrating on the streets of Brooklyn during the call with Pelosi and Biden, held up his phone so the president-elect could hear the crowds cheering, an aide said.

liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Fandos
liveUpdates.text: Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Senator Chuck Schumer called Biden at 12:45 p.m. to congratulate him and extend their support for working with his administration, an aide said.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Barack Obama expressed confidence in his former vice president: â€œI know heâ€™ll do the job with the best interests of every American at heart, whether or not he had their vote.â€

liveUpdates.author: Luke Broadwater
liveUpdates.text: Senator Josh Hawley, Republican of Missouri, said the election wasnâ€™t settled. â€œThe media do not get to determine who the president is,â€ he said. â€œThe people do.â€

liveUpdates.author: Sydney Ember
liveUpdates.text: With her ascension to the vice presidency, Kamala Harris will become the first woman and first woman of color to hold that office. A true milestone for the country.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Jeb Bush just tweeted congrats to Biden. Watch for a bunch of these from Republicans as the day goes on. Not sure it will prompt Trump to concede, but the nation is moving on.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: â€œWeâ€™re just overjoyed â€” overjoyed and grateful,â€ says Jim Biden, Joe Bidenâ€™s younger brother, who said he has spoken with the president-elect. â€œHeâ€™s doing well.â€

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Worth keeping in mind: Trumpâ€™s 2016 victory was narrow. (Lost the popular vote, and won the â€œblue wallâ€ states by 80,000 votes.) Bidenâ€™s victory is substantial (and more conventional).

liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper
liveUpdates.text: The mayor of London, Sadiq Khan, tweeted his congratulations to Joe Biden and Kamala Harris, writing,  â€œItâ€™s time to get back to building bridges, not walls.â€

liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper
liveUpdates.text: Reaction is pouring in from around the world. The mayor of Paris, Anne Hidalgo, tweeted: â€œWelcome back America!â€

liveUpdates.author: Catie Edmondson
liveUpdates.text: In one of the first statements from a G.O.P. lawmaker, Representative Fred Upton of Michigan has affirmed a Biden victory. â€œI am raising my hand and committing to working with President-elect Biden,â€ he said.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: House Democrats are nearing the 218-seat threshold needed to hold onto the majority in the chamber, with Susie Lee of Nevada clinching her re-election.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Isaac
liveUpdates.text: Facebook put a notification atop its apps that said that Joe Biden was projected as the winner. It will appear for hundreds of millions of Americans on Facebook and Instagram.

liveUpdates.author: Mike Isaac
liveUpdates.text: Twitter has added an announcement in its â€œExploreâ€ tab that Biden has been projected as the winner of the election, pointing to news outlets.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: The street celebrations recall Obamaâ€™s election in 2008. But that was a celebration of Obama. This seems (without taking anything away from Biden) very much a celebration of Trumpâ€™s ouster.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: My inbox is full of Democratic lawmakers rushing to congratulate Biden and Harris, but Republicans are notably quiet. Little, if any, reaction so far.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. will address the nation at 8 p.m. Eastern time from Wilmington, his campaign says.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Weâ€™re told that President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. was home with his family when he heard the news he had won. He has spoken with Vice President-elect Kamala Harris.

liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs
liveUpdates.text: Rudy Giuliani baselessly tried to sow doubt about the veracity of the election at a news conference after the race was called, suggesting that courts should overturn the Pa. result.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Joe Bidenâ€™s victory provides a lesson in resilience. He had run for the presidency unsuccessfully in 1988 and 2008 before finally achieving his goal in 2020.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Biden has also captured Nevada, a state where Democrats have built a powerful political machine in the last decade, largely thanks to labor unions.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Grynbaum
liveUpdates.text: On Fox News, Bret Baier referred to â€œPresident-elect Biden.â€ Chris Wallace laughed and told viewers: â€œItâ€™s going to take some getting used to.â€

liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs
liveUpdates.text: â€œObviously, heâ€™s not going to concede,â€ Rudy Giuliani, the presidentâ€™s personal lawyer, says at a news conference in Philadelphia that was scheduled before the race was called.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Minutes after networks declared Biden the winner, dozens of Trumpâ€™s supporters gathered at the Maricopa County recorder office here, where ballots were still being tabulated.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Speaker Nancy Pelosi, in a statement, says that voters â€œhave elected a unifier who values faith, family and community, and who will work tirelessly to heal our nation.â€

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Huge contrast with Clinton and Obama becoming president on waves of high hopes. Biden takes over a country in crisis, and voters know that. He may benefit from lowered expectations.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Nevada.

liveUpdates.author: Shane Goldmacher
liveUpdates.text: Joe Biden secures his election to the White House exactly 48 years to the day after he was first elected to the Senate.

liveUpdates.author: Dave Philipps
liveUpdates.text: At the Clark County elections headquarters in Las Vegas, where Trump supporters have rallied to demand that officials â€œstop the steal,â€ all is quiet right now. Not a single protester.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Senator Chuck Schumer nods to the Georgia Senate runoffs: â€œA Democratic majority in the U.S. Senate would be the biggest difference maker to help President-elect Biden deliver for working families across the country.â€

liveUpdates.author: Jonathan Martin
liveUpdates.text: Joseph Robinette Biden Jr. was elected the 46th president of the United States, making Donald J. Trump a one-term president after four years of tumult in the White House.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.: â€œItâ€™s time for America to unite. And to heal. We are the United States of America. And thereâ€™s nothing we canâ€™t do, if we do it together.â€

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: A Biden statement, echoing themes he has pressed from the beginning: â€œWith the campaign over, itâ€™s time to put the anger and the harsh rhetoric behind us and come together as a nation.â€

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Northampton County, Pa., a working-class area that once was home to Bethlehem Steel, is living up to its reputation as a bellwether. Biden appears to have flipped the county blue.

liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear
liveUpdates.text: The Drudge Report, a conservative website that has not always been kind to President Trump, used the inevitable headline: "YOUâ€™RE FIRED!â€

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Haberman
liveUpdates.text: The Trump campaign says it will continue with its legal challenges, even as most advisers realize itâ€™s unlikely to change the outcome.

liveUpdates.author: Shane Goldmacher
liveUpdates.text: The tipping-point state for Joe Biden was Pennsylvania, the state where he was born, where he kicked off his campaign and where he spent the last days of the race.
David Schweikert, Republican, wins re-election in Arizonaâ€™s Sixth Congressional District.
Conor Lamb, Democrat, wins re-election in Pennsylvaniaâ€™s 17th Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: â€œEcstatic â€” a great day for this country,â€ says Biden campaign manager Jennifer O'Malley Dillon, according to a pool report.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: The newest vote totals in Pennsylvania give Biden a lead of 34,414 votes, outside of the automatic recount threshold.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Grynbaum
liveUpdates.text: Fox News was the last major TV network to call the election for Biden, at 11:40 a.m. It was the only network that did not have its A-list anchor team on the air at 11 a.m.

liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear
liveUpdates.text: Biden was declared the winner just over an hour after Trump declared on Twitter and Facebook: â€œI WON THIS ELECTION, BY A LOT!â€ Both companies warned that was premature.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: For all the nationâ€™s divisions, Biden is on track to win a solid, even decisive election: a popular-vote margin of more than 4 million and potentially over 300 Electoral College votes.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Joseph R. Biden Jr.â€™s election as the 46th president comes after four polarizing years. He is taking over a country torn by a pandemic, an economic downturn and political strife.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper
liveUpdates.text: In New York City, as networks began to call the race, people cheered out their windows and banged pots â€” reminiscent of how they cheered essential workers early in the pandemic.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. has been elected the 46th president of the United States.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Pennsylvania.

liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear
liveUpdates.text: Trump was at his golf club in Virginia this morning as several networks and The Associated Press projected that he had lost his bid for re-election just before 11:30 a.m.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Minutes before TV networks called the race, Bidenâ€™s sister, Valerie Biden Owens, told us of this moment: â€œItâ€™s wonderful. Itâ€™s a wonderful thing for us, but itâ€™s a better thing for America.â€

liveUpdates.author: The New York Times
liveUpdates.text: The Associated Press said Joe Biden had defeated President Trump in Pennsylvania and won the presidency. The Times is now reviewing The A.P.â€™s call.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: At the Westin hotel in Wilmington, where the Biden team has set up shop, CNN is blaring and just called Pennsylvania, and the race, for Joe Biden.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: In Pennsylvania, an automatic recount is triggered when the margin is less than 0.5 percent of the total, which would currently be 33,674. At the moment, Bidenâ€™s lead is 30,908.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: The latest batch of Maricopa County votes was somewhat better for Trump than other recent batches, which means he closed the gap more than many observers expected.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper
liveUpdates.text: With the most recent release of votes in Arizona, Bidenâ€™s lead in the state now stands at 20,573 votes.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: This is the first time Maricopa County voters chose a  Democrat for president in more than 70 years. My colleagues reported on one of the biggest political shifts in the country:

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Biden is still firmly ahead in Maricopa County (Phoenix), receiving about 50 percent of the votes tallied in the county, compared with 48 percent for Trump.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Arizonaâ€™s Maricopa County, by far the largest in the state, has just released what officials say is the last large report of tallied votes.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Trump wins the new Maricopa vote by 15.6 points. Still not good enough for him. Still not going to yield a projection, I donâ€™t think.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Biden keeps inching closer to victory. He now leads in states worth over 300 electoral votes. So why hasnâ€™t the race for president been called?

liveUpdates.author: Matt Stevens
liveUpdates.text: Why is it taking so long to count in Alaska? Officials cite two reasons: the stateâ€™s late deadline for accepting absentee ballots and the process to ensure people donâ€™t vote twice.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: The closeness of the Biden-Trump race in key states suggests that the 2016 outcome may have been less about Hillary Clintonâ€™s political weaknesses than it was about Trumpâ€™s strengths.

liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear
liveUpdates.text: Trump on Saturday morning was tweeting more baseless claims about election irregularities, focusing his ire on Pennsylvania, where a loss would seal his fate as a one-term president.

liveUpdates.author: The New York Times
liveUpdates.text: Biden added to his margin in Fulton County, Ga., which includes most of Atlanta. He now leads by 7,248 votes in the state, with more than 98 percent of estimated votes reported.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Haberman
liveUpdates.text: Mark Meadows, the White House chief of staff who abided by Trumpâ€™s efforts to play down the coronavirus throughout the summer, has contracted the virus himself, a senior administration official said.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: Biden didnâ€™t get to deliver a victory speech tonight, but he says as he concludes his brief remarks, â€œI hope to be talking to you tomorrow.â€

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: Biden tries to lower the temperature: â€œWe may be opponents, but weâ€™re not enemies. Weâ€™re Americans." He adds, â€œWe have to put the anger and the demonization behind us.â€

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: Biden urges patience as votes are counted: â€œWeâ€™re proving again what weâ€™ve proved for 244 years in this country: Democracy works. Your vote will be counted.â€

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: Biden says Americans have â€œgiven us a mandate for action.â€ He adds, â€œThey made it clear they want the country to come together.â€

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: The numbers â€œtell us a clear and convincing story,â€ Biden says in Wilmington. â€œWeâ€™re going to win this race.â€

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Here in Wilmington, a number of top Biden aides have entered the room.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Election officials in both Philadelphia and Allegheny County (Pittsburgh) have stopped counting for the night and will resume Saturday morning.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: The elections chair in Erie County, Pa., said about 1,500 provisional ballots were cast there, and theyâ€™ve been about evenly split Trump-Biden. Bidenâ€™s lead will change little.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: Bidenâ€™s motorcade is en route to the Chase Center in Wilmington, where he is expected to speak shortly.

liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush
liveUpdates.text: A decade-long push by Stacey Abrams and voting rights activists played a major part in Joe Bidenâ€™s breakthrough in Georgia.

liveUpdates.author: Shane Goldmacher
liveUpdates.text: Biden hasnâ€™t been declared the winner, but heâ€™s ramping up transition planning, and some potential top White House aides could be named as early as next week.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Allegheny County (Pittsburgh) just announced a new batch of ballots counted: 7,300 for Biden, 1,875 for Trump. Bidenâ€™s lead in Pennsylvania increases to 27,130 votes.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: A number of top Biden officials and allies are on hand tonight in Wilmington, including Jake Sullivan and Steve Ricchetti, two of his close advisers, and Senator Chris Coons.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: In Arizona, Maricopa County just released another round of ballot results, and while Trump closed the gap slightly, it doesnâ€™t put him on pace to capture the state.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Biden continues to build on his lead in Pennsylvania, now leading the president by 21,705 votes after updates from Chester and Delaware counties outside Philadelphia.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Biden is expected to speak tonight regardless of the status of the uncalled races, campaign officials say.

liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Fandos
liveUpdates.text: Senator David Perdue is headed to a January runoff against Jon Ossoff, his Democratic challenger. The contest in Georgia could determine which party controls the Senate.
David Perdue and Jon Ossoff have advanced to a runoff for the U.S. Senate race in Georgia.

liveUpdates.author: Sean Keenan
liveUpdates.text: A man working at a vote-counting site in Atlanta earlier this week has gone into hiding after being wrongly accused of discarding a ballot, his boss said.

liveUpdates.author: Nicole Craine
liveUpdates.text: Volunteers went door-to-door in Atlanta and elsewhere in Georgia today to help voters correct issues with their rejected absentee ballots, a process known as curing.
liveUpdates.image_credit: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: People familiar with the Biden campaignâ€™s thinking say he may speak tonight even if the race isnâ€™t called, but the tone will be shaped by the results that are in. Things are still fluid.

liveUpdates.author: Matt Stevens
liveUpdates.text: Officials in Maricopa County, Ariz., expect to release tens of thousands of newly recorded votes around 9 p.m. ET. The remaining votes there will be key to deciding a tight race.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Biden had planned to address the nation tonight, but there are indications he may well not do so until the race is called. Things are fluid here in Wilmington!

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: New ballots from Clark County (Las Vegas) expanded Bidenâ€™s lead in Nevada. I am not aware of a reason to believe that Trump can overcome his deficit in the state.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: The latest Arizona ballot releases arenâ€™t looking great for Trump. Biden just led Yumaâ€™s update. The problem for Trump? Thatâ€™s a place where he led the count up till now.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: There are still 102,000 mail ballots to be counted in Pennsylvania. Additionally, there are at least 100,000 provisional ballots issued on Tuesday that have yet to be counted.

liveUpdates.author: Dave Philipps
liveUpdates.text: Biden nets 2,520 votes in the Las Vegas area, giving him a lead of over 22,000 in Nevada. Tens of thousands of ballots still to count, but they continue to go Bidenâ€™s way.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Iâ€™m told Biden spent the day watching election results, meeting with aides and being with his family.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: The vote count has slowed to a crawl in key states, leaving Biden tantalizingly close to 270 electoral votes, but without a clear sense of when he might reach that number.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: The stage is set up and I believe I saw teleprompters, but with the race uncalled, the timing of when weâ€™ll hear from Biden â€” who has emphasized the need to count every vote â€” appears fluid.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: The most contentious election night debates were once over networks calling the race before West Coast polls closed. As we watch decision desks hammered to make calls in PA, AZ, NV, that seems positively quaint.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: I don't think we're getting a call in Georgia for weeks, but we have such a good accounting of remaining ballots that Trump may need a tabulation error to win.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Biden gains more ground in Georgia, netting 2,725 votes in Gwinnett County, a blue-leaning suburb of Atlanta. He now leads Trump by more than 4,000 votes in the state.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Important amid lawsuits in Pa.: Ballots arriving after Election Day are segregated. They are then processed and counted separately, and, for now, not added to the current totals.

liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Fandos
liveUpdates.text: David Perdue, Republican incumbent in Georgia, is â€œexcited for overtime,â€ his campaign manager said, as he pledged to beat Jon Ossoff in a Senate runoff he hoped to avoid.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: The right is criticizing the Philadelphia count, but Trump's on track to outdo his 2016 showing there, probably due to gains with nonwhites like those he's making elsewhere.

liveUpdates.author: Neil Vigdor
liveUpdates.text: Carolyn Bourdeaux, a two-time Democratic candidate and college professor, flipped an open House seat in Georgia that had become a top priority for Democrats.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Trumpâ€™s strategy in Pa. was finding voters who didnâ€™t turn out in 2016. Looks like he succeeded. Unfortunately for him, he also turned out many first-time voters who oppose him.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Donâ€™t expect a call soon on Georgia. Itâ€™s tight, and the secretary of state said there would be a recount. This one might not be called until the results are certified.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Star-shaped balloons are now affixed to the security barrier at the outdoor site where Biden is expected to speak tonight in prime time. A crowd is already forming.
Carolyn Bourdeaux, Democrat, wins Georgiaâ€™s Seventh Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Dave Philipps
liveUpdates.text: Nevadaâ€™s Clark County, home to Democratic stronghold Las Vegas, still has 63,000 ballots to be counted. So far every update from Clark has helped Biden. Next update by 7 p.m. ET.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Philadelphia officials said that the remaining 40,000 ballots there fall into three categories: they require review, are provisional or are from military or overseas voters.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Mayor Jim Kenney of Philadelphia said the Trump campaign â€œhas not produced one iota of evidenceâ€ of voter fraud in the city.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Philadelphia officials said theyâ€™d release another update of votes from the city today, between 2,000 and 3,000 votes. The remaining 40,000 votes could take a few more days.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she has not spoken to Biden about a transition, telling reporters, â€œHe doesnâ€™t do anything until â€” and that, even to discuss â€” just until.â€

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Joe Biden plans to speak tonight during prime time, a campaign official says.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Good afternoon from Wilmington. The scene on the ground: growing activity and Biden supporters angling to catch a glimpse of the man they hope will be president-elect.
Jeff Van Drew, Republican, wins re-election in New Jerseyâ€™s Second Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Mike Noble, a Phoenix-based pollster, told me: â€œThatâ€™s a wrap for the presidential contest in AZ. Trump needed almost 60% on this ballot drop, he got very low 50s. #Ballgame.â€

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: No one has projected Nevada for Biden, but Trumpâ€™s path to victory is now exceedingly narrow. Virtually all of the remaining vote is from Clark County, which is heavily Democratic.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Nevadaâ€™s Clark County, home to Las Vegas, just delivered big for Biden â€” he picked up nearly 20,000 votes, more than double what Trump received in this drop, and moved closer to clinching the state.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: In Georgia, another 5,000 votes are expected by late morning or early afternoon from Gwinnett County, a Democratic-leaning Atlanta suburb, according to a spokesman.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Trump wins the new Maricopa County, Ariz., ballots by just five points. Don't know if itâ€™ll allow a race call, but that pace wonâ€™t cut it for the president to win the state.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: The new ballots reported in Arizonaâ€™s Maricopa County, which includes Phoenix, were not what Trump was hoping for â€” he needed to do much better to cut into Bidenâ€™s lead.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: At 11 a.m. Eastern time weâ€™re expecting more results from Maricopa County (Phoenix), where the majority of Arizonaâ€™s uncounted votes remain.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold
liveUpdates.text: More than 4,000 votes are left to be counted in Georgia, as well as an unknown number of overseas and military ballots that are still arriving, an elections official said.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold
liveUpdates.text: With a narrow margin between candidates, â€œthere will be a recount in Georgia,â€ the stateâ€™s top elections official said. Biden currently leads by about 1,500 votes.

liveUpdates.author: Dave Philipps
liveUpdates.text: Good morning from Las Vegas. A protest at the election center last night was peaceful â€” no arrests. Weâ€™re expecting about 50,000 votes to be released at 9 a.m. here (noon ET).

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: A Biden spokesman says that if Biden wins and Trump refuses to concede, â€œThe United States government is perfectly capable of escorting trespassers out of the White House.â€

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: The Trump campaign hints that no one should be expecting a Trump concession. â€œThis election is not over,â€ a campaign attorney said in a statement.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Even the recent tallies of mail ballots from red counties in Pennsylvania have favored Biden, since many Democrats voted by mail. He netted 2,500 votes from Mercer County last night.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: There are 130,000 ballots left to count in Pennsylvania, many from Democratic-leaning areas. Allegheny County (Pittsburgh) has at least 37,000, and the Philadelphia suburbs have about 20,000.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Biden gained 27,396 votes in the latest update from Philadelphia, and Trump 3,760, putting Biden in the lead. There are still roughly 20,000 ballots to count in the city.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: The votes being counted in Pennsylvania do not include any mail ballots arriving after Nov. 3. Those are being kept segregated. This count is for votes in by Election Day.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: Winning Pennsylvania would clinch the election for Biden regardless of what happens in any of the other states that remain to be called.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Biden has pulled ahead in Pennsylvania, erasing a large Trump lead from Election Day. The remaining ballots to be counted are coming from heavily Democratic areas in the state.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: The slim margin of Bidenâ€™s current lead in Georgia falls squarely into recount territory in the state â€” 0.5 percent or under.

liveUpdates.author: Mark Landler
liveUpdates.text: The next few batches of votes to be counted could vault Biden past Trump in pivotal Pennsylvania. That raises a politically fraught question for the TV networks: When would they call the race?

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Election officials in Philadelphia said more vote totals would be released Friday morning from the roughly 54,000 outstanding ballots in the city.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: In Georgia, Biden increased his lead to 1,096 over Trump after another batch of ballots came in from Clayton County, a deep blue county just south of Atlanta.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: If Biden's lead holds in Georgia, he will be the first Democrat the state has backed in a presidential race since Bill Clinton in 1992.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Election workers in surburban Gwinnett County are expected to finalize its vote this morning. Gwinnett is a blue-leaning county and the vote there has been breaking 2-1 for Biden.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Some counties sent election workers home overnight, but those in Clayton counted through the early morning, the reason the county was responsible for pushing Mr. Biden into the lead in Georgia.

liveUpdates.author: Mark Landler
liveUpdates.text: Georgia would be a landmark political and moral victory for Biden. But its short-term importance is purely mathematical: if it holds, it would block Trump from reaching 270 electoral votes.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: The votes that pushed Biden ahead of Trump in Georgia came from Clayton County, an overwhelmingly Democratic county and home to Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Biden is now in front by 917 votes in Georgia, overtaking Trump after a long night of counting. Absentee ballots from Clayton County, just south of Atlanta, broke heavily in his favor.

liveUpdates.author: The New York Times
liveUpdates.text: As more votes were counted early Friday in Georgia, Biden is now trailing Trump by just 463 votes, narrowing a gap of more than 18,000 at the start of Thursday.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: There are roughly 175,000 absentee ballots still to count in Pennsylvania, including more than 58,000 in Philadelphia. Major counties like Philadelphia will keep counting through the night.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Trumpâ€™s lead in Pennsylvania is now less than 24,000 votes after more results trickled in from Bucks and Delaware counties.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Crowley
liveUpdates.text: Democrats are urging voters in Georgia to fix absentee ballots that were rejected because of invalid or missing signatures before the deadline on Friday evening.

liveUpdates.author: Simon Romero
liveUpdates.text: Another protest by supporters of President Trump unfolded on Thursday night in front of the Phoenix building where ballots were being counted in Arizonaâ€™s largest county.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Philadelphia releases its first batch of results in hours, netting Biden more than 10,000 votes. The Trump lead in Pennsylvania is now around 26,000 votes.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Of the votes yet to be counted in Georgia, more than 5,000 come from Clayton County, a heavily Democratic area south of Atlanta.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Biden continues to close the gap with Trump in Georgia, where the presidentâ€™s margin has shrunk to 1,902 votes.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: With more votes coming in from Monroe County in eastern Pennsylvania, Trumpâ€™s margin in the state is down to 42,000 â€” with at least 208,000 ballots left to count statewide.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: Maricopa County will post its next report Friday at 11 a.m. ET. Officials there say they have 204,000 more early ballots to process, and a smaller number of provisional and other ballots.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: With the update we just got from Maricopa County, Bidenâ€™s margin over Trump in Arizona has narrowed to 1.5 points from 2.4 points this morning. About 46,000 votes separate them.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: With another batch of votes in Maricopa County (Phoenix), Bidenâ€™s lead in Arizona has shrunk. These are the last votes expected to be reported by Maricopa tonight.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: Biden continues to gain ground in Georgia. Trump now leads there by just 2,497 votes. Another 16,105 votes remain to be counted.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Biden continues to improve in Pennsylvania, where he just picked up a net of 2,500 votes in red Mercer County, where Trump currently has 63 percent of the vote.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: Around 9 p.m Eastern time weâ€™re expecting more results from Maricopa County (Phoenix), where the majority of Arizonaâ€™s uncounted votes remain.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Trumpâ€™s lead in Pennsylvania is down to just over 50,000, with at least 250,000 mail ballots left to count in the state.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: In Georgia, where Trumpâ€™s lead over Biden has shrunk to 3,486, only 18,936 ballots remain uncounted, according to Jordan Fuchs, the deputy secretary of state.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Trumpâ€™s margin continues to shrink in Pennsylvania as Biden surges in Philadelphiaâ€™s suburbs. Updates from Delaware and Bucks counties gave Biden a net gain of 5,400 votes.

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: A federal judge denied the Trump campaignâ€™s request to stop vote counting in Philadelphia, but officials agreed to expand the number of people each side could have in the room.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Trumpâ€™s remarks had a farewell tone to them as he listed all the obstacles that he is blaming for any loss. The downbeat contrast from his election night tone was startling.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Haberman
liveUpdates.text: In his first remarks to reporters in two days, Trump delivered a brief statement filled with egregious falsehoods and smears about the election process.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: More votes have been reported in Chatham and Clayton Counties, narrowing Trumpâ€™s lead in Georgia to less than 4,000.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: Erie County, Pa., a bellwether county that voted for Trump in 2016, just flipped to Biden. Trumpâ€™s lead in Pennsylvania is now less than 74,000.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Grynbaum
liveUpdates.text: The three major networks â€” ABC, CBS and NBC â€” have all cut away after Trump made false claims in an appearance at the White House.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: Biden won a new batch of votes from Cumberland County, Pa., by a margin of nearly 70 percent to 30 percent, narrowing Trumpâ€™s lead in the state to less than 80,000.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Pennsylvaniaâ€™s top election official says it may take longer than expected to complete the count there. Her office says about 326,000 mail ballots still need to be counted.

liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters
liveUpdates.text: John James, a Republican who ran against Senator Gary Peters of Michigan in a tight contest, is refusing to concede, citing vague and unsupported claims of cheating.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: In Georgiaâ€™s ongoing presidential vote tally, Biden continues to gain on Trump, narrowing the lead to fewer than 10,000 votes for the first time today.

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: The Trump campaign filed suit in federal court seeking to stop the counting in Philadelphia, arguing that its observers were denied proper access. A hearing was set for 5:30 p.m.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: More than 35,000 mail-in ballots in Allegheny County, Pa. (Pittsburgh) will not be reported today, because of state rules and court orders.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold
liveUpdates.text: Nevada has about 190,000 ballots still to be counted, the secretary of state said. Ninety percent of them are from Clark County, where Biden currently leads by 8 percentage points.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: Biden, in a brief statement to reporters, urged Americans to be patient as votes were counted and said he and Kamala Harris had â€œno doubtâ€ that they would ultimately prevail.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold
liveUpdates.text: Trumpâ€™s lead in Pennsylvania has fallen below 100,000 votes after additional results from Philadelphia and Erie counties. The secretary of state has promised an update this evening.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Why has The Times not called Arizona? The main reason: We do not believe thereâ€™s solid enough data on the votes that remain to be counted after Election Day.

liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg
liveUpdates.text: Trump notched a minor victory in Pennsylvania when a court acceded to his campaignâ€™s request to force Philadelphia election officials to grant its election observers better access.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold
liveUpdates.text: â€œWe canâ€™t know how long the process will take,â€ said Gabriel Sterling, a Georgia election official. â€œWe hope to have clarity on the outcomes of these elections as soon as possible.â€

liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold
liveUpdates.text: Georgia still has 47,277 ballots remaining to be counted, an official with the secretary of stateâ€™s office said.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: Joe Biden and Kamala Harris are receiving a briefing on the coronavirus pandemic and an economic briefing at a theater in Wilmington. Both tested negative for the virus today.

liveUpdates.author: Kathleen Gray
liveUpdates.text: A Michigan judge denied a request from the Trump campaign to halt the counting of ballots in the state, pointing out that the tallying of absentee ballots was already completed.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: The registrar in Clark County (Las Vegas) said the county would release the next batch of votes around noon ET on Friday. Remaining votes include mail and provisional ballots.

liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush
liveUpdates.text: Pennsylvaniaâ€™s secretary of state, Kathy Boockvar, said there are about 500,000 ballots yet to be counted and told CNN â€œwe definitely couldâ€ know the winner by the end of Thursday.

liveUpdates.author: Richard Fausset
liveUpdates.text: A superior court judge dismissed a lawsuit on Thursday filed by the Trump campaign that accused elections officials in Chatham County, Ga., of mishandling absentee ballots.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold
liveUpdates.text: Trumpâ€™s lead in Georgia shrank to 13,540 votes on Thursday afternoon. The secretary of state said that about 50,000 votes now remain uncounted.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper
liveUpdates.text: With Biden slowly making gains in three key states, Trump issued a written statement, in all capital letters, making baseless claims that there could be fraud in the late votes.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: With votes still being counted and no winner declared, Bidenâ€™s campaign manager, Jennifer Oâ€™Malley Dillon, told reporters today that her teamâ€™s data analysis indicated that Biden would prevail in the race.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: David Perdue has fallen under the 50 percent threshold to avoid a runoff in Georgiaâ€™s Senate race. Heâ€™s at 49.9997 percent â€” 141 votes short of winning outright with more votes still to be counted from Democratic areas.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Ballot counting in Philadelphia was briefly halted after state Democrats appealed a ruling that allowed observers to watch the process. The state Supreme Court has not accepted or rejected the appeal. Counting resumed.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold
liveUpdates.text: Joe Bidenâ€™s lead in Nevada widened to about 12,000 votes after newly tabulated votes were reported in Clark County (which includes Las Vegas). More updates are expected today.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Philadelphia election officials have not provided an update on when theyâ€™ll finish counting ballots, but next-door Bucks and Montgomery counties are nearing a full count.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Pennsylvania election officials plan to hold a news conference this afternoon. Democrats here are increasingly confident that Biden will have a big lead when all votes are counted.
Haley Stevens, Democrat, wins re-election in Michiganâ€™s 11th Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Richard Fausset
liveUpdates.text: Gabriel Sterling, Georgiaâ€™s statewide voting system implementation manager, said that 61,367 outstanding mail-in absentee ballots remained uncounted.Â The state aims to finish its count by noon.

liveUpdates.author: Mark Landler
liveUpdates.text: All eyes are on Georgia, and not just because of Trumpâ€™s dwindling lead. Senator David Perdue, Republican incumbent, may drop below 50%, which could force a Jan. runoff that could determine Senate control.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Republicans in Georgia were nervously assessing the vote count and promised to file lawsuits in a dozen or more counties aimed at knocking off votes here and there.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: In the latest results, Trump hit the percentage he needed to stay on track to potentially win Arizona, but it may not hold. The next Maricopa release is not expected until Thursday night.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Bidenâ€™s margin in Maricopa County (Phoenix) went down by 10,783 votes, to a lead of 74,514 in the county.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: Maricopa County (Phoenix) just posted its last numbers for the night, and Trump narrowed Bidenâ€™s edge in Arizona slightly â€” to 68,390 votes, or less than three percentage points.

liveUpdates.author: Simon Romero
liveUpdates.text: More than 150 pro-Trump protesters, some armed, gathered outside the Maricopa County election office and chanted â€œCount the vote,â€ as officials continued to do just that.

liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs
liveUpdates.text: Calling on election officials to â€œcount every vote,â€ protesters marched in several U.S. cities as Trump mounted an aggressive effort to challenge the vote count.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Watching Democratic Twitter angst about Arizonaâ€™s race tightening. 1) Wait for more figures before freaking out. 2) Biden has multiple paths to victory. Trumpâ€™s road is narrow.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: The margin between Trump and Biden continues to narrow in Georgia. As of 10 p.m., Trump was leading by just 33,300 votes. Counting is continuing in the Atlanta metro region.

liveUpdates.author: Patricia Cohen
liveUpdates.text: In Georgia exit polls, 38 percent of voters characterized themselves as moderates. Of that group, 63 percent said they voted for Biden, while 34 percent said they supported Trump.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Almost all of Georgiaâ€™s counties with appreciable outstanding votes are tinted blue on the map. This is why the White House is reportedly nervous about the state.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Georgia has tightened to a 39,000-vote lead for Trump. Fulton Countyâ€™s election director told CNN he expects to report all outstanding mail votes between midnight and 3 a.m.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: Officials in Maricopa County said they will release another results update after 1 a.m. ET, and another around 9 p.m. ET tomorrow.

liveUpdates.author: Patricia Cohen
liveUpdates.text: Roughly four out of 10 voters in Arizona consider themselves independent â€” and a majority of them voted for Biden over Trump.

liveUpdates.author: Patricia Cohen
liveUpdates.text: Arizonaâ€™s Maricopa County, where new results are starting to come in, saw its jobless rate fall to 6.3 percent in September, about half of what it was early in the pandemic.

liveUpdates.author: Patricia Cohen
liveUpdates.text: In Georgia, where the race is tightening, 45 percent of voters said they're doing better today than four years ago. In that group, nearly four of five supported Trump.
Gary Peters, Democrat, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Michigan.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: New results from Maricopa County are beginning to come in, with Biden maintaining a lead. This is just the beginning in Arizona, as 600,000 votes are still outstanding.
Peter Meijer, Republican, wins Michiganâ€™s Third Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Jacey Fortin
liveUpdates.text: Richard L. Barron, the elections director of Fulton County, Ga., said he expected all votes there to be counted overnight, although it may stretch well after midnight.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: The presidential vote grows tighter in Georgia as mail ballots are counted. Trumpâ€™s lead has narrowed to 46,000 votes, or 1 percentage point.
Victoria Spartz, Republican, wins Indianaâ€™s Fifth Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Sydney Ember
liveUpdates.text: Bidenâ€™s campaign, in another move to assert that heâ€™s headed toward victory, has launched a transition team website. It borrows a theme from his campaign: BuildBackBetter.com.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: After suggesting that they may release additional results on Wednesday, state officials in Nevada reverted to their original plan of updating results Thursday at noon Eastern.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: Could Trump still win? Not easy, not impossible. First: win Arizona (tough). Second: hold Georgia (very possible). Third: hang on in Pennsylvania (maybe).

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Speaker Nancy Pelosi acknowledged a â€œchallenging electionâ€ in a letter to Democrats, after multiple first-term House Democrats lost their seats to Republicans.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Trumpâ€™s lead is down to 5 points in Pennsylvania. Itâ€™s not clear how much more counting thereâ€™ll be by nightfall, but his margin has already been more than cut in half today.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Trumpâ€™s lead in Georgia is down to 1.4 points with a lot of Democratic vote still out. Will be razor thin here, and a recount seems likely either way.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: With Nevada releasing additional ballots later today, Biden now has a reasonable path to clearing the 270 electoral vote threshold tonight.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: Officials in Nevada had previously said that results would not be updated until Thursday morning, but they have since indicated they may release more today.

liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters
liveUpdates.text: Bidenâ€™s narrow win in Michigan was the product of extremely high turnout in Detroit, where an underwhelming performance with Black voters in 2016 helped doom Hillary Clinton.

liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters
liveUpdates.text: In winning Michigan, Biden has clawed back another state that was long part of the Democratic Partyâ€™s bulwark in the industrial North until Trumpâ€™s narrow 2016 victory.

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: Joe Biden has flipped Michigan, along with Wisconsin. Wins in Arizona and Nevada would get him to 270 electoral votes. Or, Pennsylvania would put him over the top.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Michigan.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: Biden cites the turnout in Tuesdayâ€™s election and pays tribute to democracy. â€œHere, the people rule,â€ he says. â€œPower canâ€™t be taken or asserted. It flows from the people.â€

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: â€œIâ€™m not here to declare that weâ€™ve won, but I am here to report that when the count is finished, we believe we will be the winners,â€ Biden says in his speech.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: In a speech here, Biden says itâ€™s â€œclearâ€ that he will reach 270 electoral votes and win the presidency, though he stops short of claiming victory.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: Biden is on his way to the Chase Center in Wilmington, where he will give remarks this afternoon.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Grynbaum
liveUpdates.text: On Fox News, Chris Wallace tells viewers the WI pickup is key for Biden: â€œItâ€™s real simple math now. Six votes in NV, 16 votes in MI, and he reaches precisely the magic number.â€ (Fox has called AZ for Biden.)

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: Officials in Maricopa County, which includes Phoenix, have said they will update results around 9 p.m. Eastern (7 p.m. local time) on Wednesday.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Weâ€™ve gotten a bit more data in Pennsylvania, which narrows Trumpâ€™s lead to 8 points. To my mind, everything there is still consistent with Biden eventually taking the lead.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: The likeliest outcome by far in Arizona is that the remaining ballots are good enough for Biden. But I donâ€™t think we can be 100 percent confident until we've seen some of them.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Trumpâ€™s campaign manager says heâ€™ll request a recount in Wisconsin, though it may be up to two weeks before one can begin. In 2016 a statewide recount increased Trumpâ€™s margin by 131 votes.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Joe Biden has won Wisconsin, according to The Associated Press, flipping a state President Trump narrowly won in 2016.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Wisconsin.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Susan Collins becomes the first senator to be elected by Maine voters to a fifth term, and will become the longest-serving Republican woman in the history of the Senate.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: Biden is now raising money for a new â€œBiden Fight Fund,â€ which will finance â€œelection protection efforts for Joe Biden and Democrats up and down the ballot,â€ his campaign manager says.
Elissa Slotkin, Democrat, wins re-election in Michiganâ€™s Eighth Congressional District.
Susan Collins, Republican, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Maine.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Sara Gideon, conceding the Senate race in Maine, tells supporters: â€œWe built a movement that will help us make progress for years to come.â€ (The A.P. hasnâ€™t called the race.)
Jared Golden, Democrat, wins re-election in Maineâ€™s Second Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Of the 200,000 uncounted votes in Georgia, most come from left-leaning areas of metropolitan Atlanta, suggesting theyâ€™re likely to skew Democratic.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: An estimated 200,000 votes remain uncounted in Georgia, officials say â€” thatâ€™s more than double Trumpâ€™s current margin over Biden in the state.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Senator Susan Collins of Maine says she received â€œa very gracious callâ€ from Sara Gideon, her Democratic opponent, conceding the race. The A.P. has not called a winner.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: The margin needs to be less than 1 percent for a recount in Wisconsin. Trump will have to pay about $3 million for it unless the margin is less than one quarter of 1 percent.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Trump campaign manager Bill Stepien said in a statement that Trump â€œis well within the threshold to request a recountâ€ in Wisconsin, and that the campaign planned to â€œimmediately do so.â€

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: There are only about 300 votes left to count in Wisconsin, officials say. Theyâ€™re in the town of Willow in Richland County. Biden leads by more than 20,000 votes.

liveUpdates.author: Astead Herndon
liveUpdates.text: A new batch of votes reported this hour in Georgia has cut Trumpâ€™s lead there to just under 90,000 votes.

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: Biden has expanded his lead to more than 30,000 votes in Michigan, with a new batch coming in from Wayne County (Detroit). His current margin is bigger than Trumpâ€™s in 2016.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Twitter slapped warnings on multiple presidential tweets and retweets this morning, warning that Trumpâ€™s statements about â€œsurprise ballot dumpsâ€ were misleading.
Elaine Luria, Democrat, wins re-election in Virginiaâ€™s Second Congressional District.
Mondaire Jones, Democrat, wins New Yorkâ€™s 17th Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: Biden is expected to address the American people at some point today, his campaign manager, Jennifer Oâ€™Malley Dillon, tells reporters.
Ashley Hinson, Republican, wins Iowaâ€™s First Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Trump campaign officials tell reporters that â€œif all legally cast ballots are counted, we believe the president will win.â€ They continue to describe Fox News, A.P. calls of Arizona for Biden as â€œjust plain wrong.â€

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: â€œIf we count all legal ballots, the president wins,â€ Trump campaign manager Bill Stepien said on a call with reporters, and took no questions. The call came hours after Trump said he wanted to stop vote counting.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: In a press briefing, Jennifer Oâ€™Malley Dillon, Biden's campaign manager, says, â€œJoe Biden is on track to win this election, and he will be the next president of the United States.â€

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Trump campaign manager Bill Stepien is projecting confidence in the president's chances in Wisconsin, Michigan, Nevada and Georgia. He said Wisconsin was headed to â€œrecount territory.â€

liveUpdates.author: Mark Landler
liveUpdates.text: In shot at Trump, Simon Coveney, Irelandâ€™s foreign minister, said it would be unwise to claim victory before all votes counted. His U.K. counterpart, Dominic Raab, said the vote would provide a â€œdefinitive result.â€

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: Biden pulled ahead in Michigan, as another batch of votes rolled in from Wayne County, where Detroit is located. That heavily Democratic area is currently reporting about 70% of returns.
Lauren Boebert, Republican, wins Coloradoâ€™s Third Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Biden has won Pennsylvania absentee ballots by an overwhelming margin so far. If he carried the remaining absentee ballots by a similar margin, he would win the state.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Trump leads by nearly 700,000 votes in Pennsylvania. Bidenâ€™s chances there depend on whether he can win a large percentage of more than 1.4 million uncounted absentee ballots.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: Nevadaâ€™s election division announced that no more results will be given until noon Eastern on Thursday. Remaining votes include mail ballots received on Election Day.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: The absentee ballot results in Green Bay, Wis., are delayed because one of the vote-counting machines ran out of ink. An elections official had to return to City Hall to get more.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: After the city of Milwaukee reported its 169,000 absentee and early votes, Joe Biden pulled to a narrow lead in Wisconsin. Green Bay's early votes remain outstanding.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: I donâ€™t think people have fully internalized how Democratic these mail and absentee ballots will be in MI/PA/WI. Itâ€™s close, but these ballots will be overwhelmingly blue.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: This is vaguely reminiscent of 11 p.m. in 2016 ... but in reverse (and in slow motion): Bidenâ€™s the narrow favorite in PA, WI, MI, AZ, NV, GA, and it could take a while.
