Fred Upton, Republican, wins re-election in Michiganâ€™s Sixth Congressional District.
Rashida Tlaib, Democrat, wins re-election in Michiganâ€™s 13th Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: In Pennsylvania, a legal battle is quickly ramping up. Republicans filed a number of lawsuits during the day on Tuesday, with two cases scheduled to be heard on Wednesday.

liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina
liveUpdates.text: In Arizona, where the majority of voters have long cast ballots by mail, officials expect to finish counting ballots on Wednesday.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: In Wisconsin, the cities of Milwaukee and Green Bay, among several others, including Kenosha and Beloit, are still waiting to count votes cast before Election Day.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: There is still a large share of uncounted votes in Pennsylvaniaâ€™s most populous counties, including Philadelphia and Allegheny (Pittsburgh), and the largest suburban county, Montgomery.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: Results are coming in from Alaska, but the only votes reported will be from in-person early voting and Election Day voting. No mail ballots will be counted for about a week.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Grynbaum
liveUpdates.text: Chris Christie, who worked with Trump on debate prep, criticized the presidentâ€™s White House speech on ABC: â€œItâ€™s a bad strategic decision. Itâ€™s a bad political decision.â€

liveUpdates.author: Michael Grynbaum
liveUpdates.text: Chris Wallace, on Fox News, reacted to Trumpâ€™s speech by saying: â€œThis is an extremely flammable situation and the president just threw a match into it. He hasnâ€™t won these states.â€
Tony Gonzales, Republican, wins Texasâ€™ 23rd Congressional District.
Stephanie Bice, Republican, wins Oklahomaâ€™s Fifth Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Steve Bullock conceded the Montana Senate race to Senator Steve Daines. â€œI am sufficiently idealistic enough to believe that Washington could work a lot better,â€ Bullock said.

liveUpdates.author: Danny Hakim
liveUpdates.text: The North Carolina race was the most expensive advertising battle in Senate history, according to Advertising Analytics. The campaigns spent nearly $260 million on ads.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Maine.
Mark Kelly, Democrat, wins the Senate special election in Arizona.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Before Trumpâ€™s false claims, his campaign was already fund-raising off the uncertain outcome. A 12:03 a.m. plea asked for money to help â€œprotect the integrity of this Election.â€

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: With no winner in the presidential race, Trump falsely asserted that he had prevailed.

liveUpdates.author: Danny Hakim
liveUpdates.text: Thereâ€™s still no winner in one of the most closely watched Senate races, the contest in North Carolina between Thom Tillis, the Republican incumbent, and Cal Cunningham.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Trump entered the White Houseâ€™s East Room at 2:21 a.m. and told a crowd of maskless supporters it was â€œthe latest news conference Iâ€™ve ever had.â€
Yvette Herrell, Republican, wins New Mexicoâ€™s Second Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Biden is ahead by 5 points in Nevada now. Thatâ€™s probably enough; it did loom as a potential complication for him after results in heavily Latino parts of Florida/Texas.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Trumpâ€™s lead in Georgia is down to 2.5 points. The Needle is unmoved on the news, with Biden still a very narrow favorite.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Erie County, Pa., counted 13,121 mail ballots, which Biden won 5 to 1.Â There are 37,000 mail votes still out; Dems expect him to carry them by at least 3 to 1. That means he would win this bellwether county.
Chip Roy, Republican, wins re-election in Texasâ€™ 21st Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Biden has won a single Electoral College vote in Nebraskaâ€™s 2nd Congressional District. â€œOmaha is now Jomaha,â€ said Jane Kleeb, the Nebraska Democratic Party chairwoman.
Bob Good, Republican, wins Virginiaâ€™s Fifth Congressional District.
Steve Daines, Republican, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Montana.
Don Bacon, Republican, wins re-election in Nebraskaâ€™s Second Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Georgiaâ€™s 7th Congressional District race is down to the wire. Carolyn Bourdeaux, the Democrat, leads Rich McCormick by fewer than 9,000 votes for the open seat. (Corrects an editing error.)
Lucy McBath, Democrat, wins re-election in Georgiaâ€™s Sixth Congressional District.
Michelle Fischbach, Republican, wins Minnesotaâ€™s Seventh Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Earlier in Mississippi, Mike Espy conceded to his opponent, Senator Cindy Hyde-Smith, telling followers to continue their effort for â€œa new Mississippi, a united Mississippi.â€

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: After giving brief remarks, Biden has returned home and his campaign has called a lid, meaning he is not expected to make any further in-person appearances tonight.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Representative Kendra Horn, the lone Democrat in the Oklahoma delegation, has conceded to Stephanie Bice, her Republican challenger.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Last week, Trump cut a rally in Minnesota short after state officials said his crowd could not exceed 250 people. He claimed his supporters were â€œbarred from entry by radical Democrats.â€
Donald J. Trump wins Texas.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Bidenâ€™s win in Minnesota secured another state the Trump campaign had hoped to flip. Trump has long fixated on the state as one that got away in 2016, when he lost by only 1.5 points.
Tina Smith, Democrat, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Minnesota.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Biden issued a warning shot on Twitter: â€œItâ€™s not my place or Donald Trumpâ€™s place to declare the winner of this election. Itâ€™s the votersâ€™ place.â€

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Twitter placed a warning label on Trumpâ€™s tweet that claimed without evidence that Democrats were trying to steal the election, noting that the tweet contained misleading information.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Sara Gideonâ€™s team has told reporters she will not be making a speech tonight. Instead, the campaign said in a statement, â€œItâ€™s clear the race will not be called tonight.â€
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Minnesota.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Another reason the Needle has Biden edging ahead in Georgia: For a while, it was taking cues from trends in N.C. and Florida. Now we've seen enough vote in the Atlanta area.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Trump tweeted that he, too, would make a statement shortly.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Why did the Needle turn blue in Georgia? We got enough vote out of the Atlanta area to realize it was going to be really good for Biden. And there's a ton of vote left there.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Trumpâ€™s first tweet of the night came as Biden made his remarks, a sign he was glued to his TV. â€œWe are up BIG,â€ he said, while continuing to cast doubt, without evidence, on the election results.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Biden says his running mate, Senator Kamala Harris, will speak tomorrow.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Bidenâ€™s brief remarks are over. He projected optimism even as many Democrats are deeply anxious about the results so far.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Biden lays down the marker: â€œWeâ€™re going to win Pennsylvania,â€ the state of his birth, where he just spent three days campaigning.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Biden is speaking. â€œWe believe weâ€™re on track to win this election.â€
Greg Gianforte, Republican, wins the Governorâ€™s race in Montana.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: The TVs playing election results at Bidenâ€™s watch party are now off, a sign we may be hearing from Biden soon.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Applause and car honking in Wilmington amid an NBC News announcement that Minnesota leans Biden. Then quiet in the parking lot when NBC calls Florida for Trump.
Joni Ernst, Republican, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Iowa.
Donald J. Trump wins Florida.
Peter DeFazio, Democrat, wins re-election in Oregonâ€™s Fourth Congressional District.
Ben Ray LujÃ¡n, Democrat, wins the U.S. Senate seat in New Mexico.
Donald J. Trump wins Iowa.
Donald J. Trump wins Montana.
Tom Malinowski, Democrat, wins re-election in New Jerseyâ€™s Seventh Congressional District.
Troy Nehls, Republican, wins Texasâ€™ 22nd Congressional District
Donald J. Trump wins Ohio.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Hawaii.

liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan
liveUpdates.text: A sign of confidence from Biden world: Rufus Gifford, one of his deputy campaign managers, tweeted shortly before midnight, â€œWeâ€™re going to win.â€

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Atlanta wonâ€™t finish its count tonight. Election workers in Fulton County, who were counting absentee ballots, went home for the night. A water line break delayed the count.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: It is taking longer than expected to count the ballots in several places in Wisconsin because officials have found the machines do not count ballots as fast as theyâ€™d expected.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Remember, as you see Wisconsin results come in, that in many jurisdictions the absentee ballots wonâ€™t be counted and reported until ALL the absentee ballots are counted.

liveUpdates.author: Astead Herndon
liveUpdates.text: Georgia might be the center of the political universe in the next two months. With at least one and possibly two Senate runoffs, Georgia could have Senate control in its hands.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Trump leads in Peach County, Ga., considered a bellwether. The Middle Georgia county has picked all but one winner of the White House since 1992.
Elise Stefanik, Republican, wins re-election in New Yorkâ€™s 21st Congressional District

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Is Trump driving up his share of white blue-collar voters?Â  In Trumbull County, Ohio â€” which Obama won in 2012 and Trump won in 2016 â€” Trump is outperforming his 2016 numbers.
Raphael Warnock and Kelly Loeffler have advanced to a runoff for the Senate special election in Georgia.
Rodney Davis, Republican, wins re-election in Illinoisâ€™s 13th Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Biden won New Hampshire, a state that the Trump campaign, pre-pandemic, had made a key target in its efforts to expand the map. Clinton won it by just a few thousand votes.

liveUpdates.author: Elaina Plott
liveUpdates.text: Republicans are breathing easier in Ohio. With much of the vote counted, Trump has pulled about eight percentage points ahead of Biden â€” and he won by eight points in 2016.
Cindy Hyde-Smith, Republican, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Mississippi.
Bill Cassidy, Republican, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Louisiana.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: How is the election playing in Peoria? Clinton won the blue-collar downstate Illinois county by 3 points in 2016. Biden is leading by 6 points with most of the vote counted.
Donald J. Trump wins Utah.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Rep. Doug Collins of Georgia has conceded in the special U.S. Senate race, saying he contacted Senator Kelly Loeffler to offer his support for her in a likely January runoff.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins New Hampshire.
Gov. Jay Inslee, Democrat, wins re-election in Washington State.
Jeff Merkley, Democrat, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Oregon.
Jim Risch, Republican, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Idaho.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: The polls are now closed in California, Oregon, Idaho and Washington State.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Washington State.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Oregon.
Donald J. Trump wins Idaho.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins California.
Roger Marshall, Republican, wins the U.S. Senate seat in Kansas.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Lina Hidalgo, the Harris County judge, said turnout in the county, which includes Houston, hit at least 65%, the highest since 1992. So far, itâ€™s not enough for Biden in Texas.

liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Casey
liveUpdates.text: Voters in Florida and Colorado have decided that voting should be only for citizens. No oneâ€™s sure what difference it makes: Only citizens were able to vote before.

liveUpdates.author: Patricia Cohen
liveUpdates.text: Biden made a big bid to reclaim union voters. But in Ohio, union voters went for Trump over Biden by 56 percent to 42 percent, according to exit polls.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: As the Biden outdoor watch party gets underway, a few attendees are dancing. Some are anxious. Itâ€™s a drive-in rally and likely designed to include only a fairly small crowd.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Keep an eye on Erie County, Pa., a bellwether for the state.  Itâ€™s reporting Election Day results first, which favor Trump.  But about 21,000 mail ballots are expected after 11 p.m.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Marjorie Taylor Greene, who has supported the convoluted far-right QAnon conspiracy, is headed to Congress. Her opponent in Georgia withdrew from the race.
Gov. Mike Parson, Republican, wins re-election in Missouri.
Gov. Roy Cooper, Democrat, wins re-election in North Carolina.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Cars are pulling in to an outdoor watch party here in support of Biden. MSNBC is on the big screens and Lady Gaga is playing on the speakers. She appeared with Biden on Monday.
Donald J. Trump wins Missouri.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: The early exit polls of Arizona show voters over 65 prefer Biden by 5 percentage points.Â In other words, this is not your grandparentsâ€™ Arizona, full of conservative retirees.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Trump campaign officials said they were optimistic about the numbers they were seeing with Hispanic voters in Nevada, following the same trend in Florida.

liveUpdates.author: Elaina Plott
liveUpdates.text: With most votes counted in Ohioâ€™s heavily suburban Delaware County, Trump has a five-point lead there. Trump carried this county by 16 points in 2016.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Biden leads Maricopa County by 10 points so far, with three-quarters of its vote estimated to be counted. If that margin holds up it will be difficult for Trump to win Arizona.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: A correction: The polls are not closed in all of Nevada yet. A judge ordered a one-hour extension in Clark County, which includes Las Vegas.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Arizona has reported much of its early vote â€” expected to favor Dems â€” and Biden has a big lead in Maricopa County, which accounts for about 60 percent of the stateâ€™s voters.
Carlos Gimenez, Republican, wins Floridaâ€™s 26th Congressional District.
Tommy Tuberville, Republican, wins the U.S. Senate seat in Alabama.
Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, Democrat, wins re-election in New Yorkâ€™s 14th Congressional District.
John Cornyn, Republican, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Texas.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: We can expect to start seeing results come in from Arizona now, one hour after its polls closed.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Ritchie Torres will be the first openly gay Black member of Congress, most likely sharing that distinction with Mondaire Jones, whose race has not yet been called.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: The polls just closed in Iowa, Montana, Utah and parts of Nevada and Idaho.
Spencer Cox, Republican, wins the Governorâ€™s race in Utah.
Donald J. Trump wins Kansas.
Ritchie Torres, Democrat, wins New Yorkâ€™s 15th Congressional District.
Lindsay Graham (Rep.) re-elected to U.S. Senate in South Carolina, defeating Jaime Harrison.

liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters
liveUpdates.text: The incomplete Michigan results reflect a Trump advantage because the largest chunk is coming from Oakland Countyâ€™s Election Day vote. Many more absentee votes are still out.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Former Gov. John Hickenlooper of Colorado is the first Democrat to flip a Senate seat tonight in the partyâ€™s quest to retake the Senate majority.

liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters
liveUpdates.text: Republicans knew John James would have to outperform Trump to win the Senate race in Michigan. So far, in the two biggest counties, thatâ€™s not happening. But itâ€™s early.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Spotted at the White House: Education Secretary Betsy DeVos; Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin; Robert Lighthizer, the trade representative; Acting D.H.S. Secretary Chad Wolf.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: At the White House right now, a few hundred guests are gathered and eating sliders, fries and hors dâ€™oeuvres, people tell me. The screens are tuned to, wait for it, Fox News.
Ilhan Omar, Democrat, wins re-election in Minnesotaâ€™s Fifth Congressional District.
John Hickenlooper, Democrat, wins the U.S. Senate seat in Colorado.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Mayor Nan Whaley of Dayton, Ohio, says Bidenâ€™s lead right now in Montgomery County is encouraging. â€œThe question of the night: Will the suburban ladies rule?â€
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Colorado.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Madison, Wis., is reporting results more quickly, since the city clerk here shipped absentee ballots to be counted at precincts where the voters live, easing the bottleneck.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Some of Wisconsinâ€™s biggest cities â€” Milwaukee and Green Bay â€” will be very late in reporting results tonight, in part because they count all the early ballots separately.

liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney
liveUpdates.text: If Ohio ends up going for Biden â€” if â€” itâ€™s a surprise and arguably a bigger deal than Florida. Not only is Ohio a big prize, it would suggest Biden strength in Pennsylvania.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Madison Cawthorn, 25, will be among the youngest lawmakers in the modern history of Congress, and is the first member of Congress to be born in the 1990s.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins the District of Columbia.

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: In national exit polls, Biden wins most voters who went third-party or didnâ€™t vote in 2016. Had Clinton gotten those voters in key states, she might have won four years ago.
Madison Cawthorn, Republican, wins North Carolinaâ€™s 11th Congressional District.
Marjorie Taylor Greene, Republican, wins Georgiaâ€™s 14th Congressional District.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Biden winning New York is not surprising, but in August, Trump told The New York Post he was â€œputting New York in play.â€ He said he would campaign there. He did not.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Cynthia Lummis will replace Senator Mike Enzi of Wyoming, who is retiring, in the Senate. She will add to the ranks of Republican women in the upper chamber.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: Polls are closing in Arizona, but weâ€™ll have to wait about an hour for results. Early and mail ballots, likely to be relatively stronger for Democrats, will be reported first.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: Polls are closing in New York, but only in-person votes will be released on election night. Mail ballots will be reported over the next days and weeks.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: Polls are closing in Wisconsin. The governor has said he expects to know the results tonight or tomorrow. Milwaukee could still be counting ballots until Wednesday morning.
Cynthia Lummis, Republican, wins the U.S. Senate seat in Wyoming.
Gov. Doug Burgum, Republican, wins re-election in North Dakota.
Mike Rounds, Republican, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in South Dakota.
Ben Sasse, Republican, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Nebraska.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Trump campaign officials are keeping an eye on R.N.C. data that suggests that Biden might be under-performing in urban areas in Minnesota, a state Trump hopes to flip. (This corrects an editing error in an earlier post.)
Donald J. Trump wins Nebraska.
Donald J. Trump wins Wyoming.
Donald J. Trump wins South Dakota.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins New York.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins New Mexico.
Donald J. Trump wins North Dakota.
Donald J. Trump wins Louisiana.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: The polls are now closed in all of Michigan and Texas, as well as Arizona, Colorado, Minnesota, New York, Wisconsin and several other states.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: With early, in-person tallies coming in from Atlanta, it looks like Biden is doing well in Fulton County. Clinton had 68% of the vote there. Biden is doing 10 points better.
Donald J. Trump wins Indiana.

liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters
liveUpdates.text: Republicans said earlier today that North Carolina was tight. Now, as results start to come in there, Iâ€™m not hearing much relief. Itâ€™s still tighter than theyâ€™d like it to be.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Pennsylvania results are only trickling in, but Democrats are encouraged by the early voting tilt. Registered Democrats cast over one million more early votes than Republicans.

liveUpdates.author: Patricia Cohen
liveUpdates.text: In Florida exit polls, 42% said they were better off today than 4 years ago. Only 20% said they were worse off. And 3 out of 4 people in that better-off group went for Trump.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: So far Biden is outperforming Clintonâ€™s numbers in Houston and Dallas, but if he is to win the state he probably needs to exceed 2016 by more than he is doing right now.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: The big thing to watch in Texas, along with suburbs like Williamson County, is the margins in Harris County (Houston) and Dallas County.
Gov. Phil Scott, Republican, wins re-election in Vermont.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Democrats are stunned to see the Texas suburb of Williamson County go blue in a presidential election. Beto Oâ€™Rourke flipped it in his losing challenge to Senator Ted Cruz.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Georgiaâ€™s Cobb County has counted about a third of its votes so far â€” if Bidenâ€™s lead comes close to holding, it will cement the suburban shift away from Republicans.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: The polls just closed in Arkansas. (No surprises in the presidential and Senate calls there.)

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: The Georgia numbers are early, but Biden at 63% in Cobb County is striking. Clinton won Cobb by two points, the first time in decades the Atlanta suburb backed a Democrat.
Donald J. Trump wins Arkansas.
Tom Cotton, Republican, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Arkansas.

liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters
liveUpdates.text: We should have more results out of Michigan soon. Detroitâ€™s early-vote counting is moving along. So far Oakland County is the only one to report much (and itâ€™s not a lot).

liveUpdates.author: Astead Herndon
liveUpdates.text: If thereâ€™s a good sign for Biden, heâ€™s outperformed Clinton in Florida outside of Miami-Dade. He needs the swing to Trump to be localized to Cuban-Americans in South Florida.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Trump campaign officials are excited that they appear to be over-performing with Hispanic voters in Florida, compared to 2016.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper
liveUpdates.text: The other swing-state data coming in: On Election Day,Â  Pennsylvania, Ohio and Minnesota all set records for the most new coronavirus cases theyâ€™ve reported in a single day.

liveUpdates.author: Luke Broadwater
liveUpdates.text: The Postal Service said in an afternoon filing it had delivered every delayed ballot from the Miami-Dade facility, where backed-up mail caused much concern over the weekend.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: The early exit polling data from Georgia suggests that Trump managed to bring around 10 percent of Black voters into his column.

liveUpdates.author: Elaina Plott
liveUpdates.text: With the early vote in, Biden has a lead over Trump in Ohioâ€™s Delaware County, a G.O.P. stronghold. Delaware County is heavily suburban, and no Democrat has won it since 1916.

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: It may not hold, but seeing a Democrat up early in Texas is kind of shocking. Whether Biden wins or not, that state is changing fast â€” largely because of the shifting suburbs.

liveUpdates.author: Astead Herndon
liveUpdates.text: Biden is getting the margins statewide that his campaign hoped for in Florida. Itâ€™s that very bad Miami-Dade County return that has swung the state toward Trump.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Pause for a moment to consider that Virginia was called for Biden less than an hour after polls closed. It was a swing state not long ago, won by George W. Bush in 2004.

liveUpdates.author: Luke Broadwater
liveUpdates.text: Democratic donors spent more than $100 million opposing Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, and he wins in one of the quickest-called races of the night.
Mitch McConnell, Republican, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Kentucky.
Gov. John Carney, Democrat, wins re-election in Delaware.
Bill Hagerty, Republican, wins the U.S. Senate seat in Tennessee.
Jack Reed, Democrat, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Rhode Island.
Jim Inhofe, Republican, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Oklahoma.
Jeanne Shaheen, Democrat, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in New Hampshire.
Gov. Chris Sununu, Republican, wins re-election in New Hampshire.
Cory Booker, Democrat, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in New Jersey.
Edward J. Markey, Democrat, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Massachusetts.
Richard J. Durbin, Democrat, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Illinois.
Christopher Coons, Democrat, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Delaware.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Rhode Island.
Donald J. Trump wins Oklahoma.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: Officials in Pennsylvania and Michigan say that counting mail ballots â€” and therefore most results â€” could take until Nov. 6.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins New Jersey.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Massachusetts.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Maryland.
Donald J. Trump wins Tennessee.
Donald J. Trump wins Mississippi.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Illinois.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Connecticut.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Delaware.
Donald J. Trump wins Alabama.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: The polls just closed in 21 states and Washington, D.C. Among them: Florida, Pennsylvania, and most of Michigan and Texas.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Dems had poured a ton of money into Florida. Since Labor Day, the Biden campaign spent $78 million on ads there, and a Bloomberg-aligned super PAC spent another $36 million.
Donald J. Trump wins South Carolina.

liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni
liveUpdates.text: Early Florida results are exceeding the Trump campaignâ€™s expectations. Bill Stepien, the campaign manager, earlier today said he expected early vote totals to favor Democrats.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Biden is ahead of Clintonâ€™s vote totals in some big Florida counties â€” Duval and Orange â€” even without all votes counted.Â May not be enough to make up for the bleeding in Miami.

liveUpdates.author: Elaina Plott
liveUpdates.text: Absentee and early vote results are rolling into Franklin County, the most populous in Ohio. As expected, Biden holds a wide lead over Trump. Weâ€™ll watch the in-person count.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Byron Donalds won in Florida, ensuring that the House G.O.P. conference will have least one Black member, with Will Hurd of Texas retiring at the end of the year.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Trump is doing way better than â€™16 in Hispanic and Cuban areas, and better in Black areas. Biden is doing better in older, white areas, but not by as much.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Republican officials in Wisconsin are also saying they think Milwaukee Election Day turnout has been soft today.

liveUpdates.author: Astead Herndon
liveUpdates.text: Democratic officials in Milwaukee are adjusting their expectations. In-person turnout in Milwaukee has not met the biggest expectations, although it looks improved from 2016.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Iâ€™m curious what Trumpâ€™s performance in Miami-Dade County will mean for Debbie Mucarsel-Powell and Donna Shalala â€” two freshmen Dems defending House seats in South Florida.

liveUpdates.author: Elaina Plott
liveUpdates.text: The Trump campaignâ€™s monthslong investment in Miami-Dade County appears to have paid off. Trump is running more than 120,000 votes ahead of his 2016 performance.

liveUpdates.author: Matt Stevens
liveUpdates.text: Some polling places in Cook County, Ill. (Chicago) were relocated at the last minute or opened late. A court ordered that 17 suburban precincts be kept open an extra hour.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Virginia.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: With polls now closed in several states, you can track which major news networks have called states, all in one place.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Jordan Fuchs, Georgiaâ€™s deputy secretary of state, says Spalding County, which Trump won in â€™16, will keep polls open an extra two hours due to an equipment malfunction today.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: The polls just closed in Ohio and West Virginia. Most polls are now closed in North Carolina, too, but a handful of precincts will be open longer because of delays.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: If there's any consolation for Democrats, this Miami-Dade result, way worse for Biden than expected, is not something we expect to see repeated elsewhere in the country.
Donald J. Trump wins West Virginia.
Shelley Moore  Capito, Republican, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in West Virginia.
Gov. Jim Justice, Republican, wins re-election in West Virginia.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Trump opens as a clear favorite in Florida, especially after the Miami-Dade early vote.

liveUpdates.author: Luke Broadwater
liveUpdates.text: In Iowa, Senator Joni Ernst and her Democratic challenger Theresa Greenfield are holding election night events at hotels literally around the block from each other here.

liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane
liveUpdates.text: Mark Warner, Democrat of Virginia, is the first called Senate winner of the night, a stark contrast from 2014 when he won by just under 18,000 votes.

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: Retirees in the Villages, Fla., are a politically conservative lot. If Biden is cutting into Trumpâ€™s coalition with older voters, we should see some support in Sumter County.

liveUpdates.author: Elaina Plott
liveUpdates.text: Ohio voters ranked the coronavirus as their top concern in an A.P. voter survey. On Tuesday, the state reported its highest number of virus cases since the pandemic began.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: In the early national exit polls, hereâ€™s how people identified their party: Democratic 38 percent; Republican 35 percent; independent or something else 28 percent.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: The early exit polls suggest the changing demographics of U.S. voters.Â Only 65% of voters are white in this preliminary estimate; in 2016, 73% were, according to the census.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: An interesting lawsuit was just filed in Nevada by the Trump campaign, asking to keep voting open for an extra hour in Clark County because of earlier technical difficulties.

liveUpdates.author: Patricia Cohen
liveUpdates.text: Stocks rallied today. The betting on Wall Street has favored a Biden victory, which traders expect will bring a bigger stimulus bill.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: The needle is making its way to the internet. It'll open with Biden favored by the margin of the polls, and it's based on absolutely nothing except the polls.

liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano
liveUpdates.text: In Florida, early voting and counted mail ballots, which are likely to be stronger for Democrats, are expected by 8:30 p.m. ET.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Vermont.
Mark Warner, Democrat, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Virginia.
Gov. Eric Holcomb, Republican, wins re-election in Indiana.
Donald J. Trump wins Kentucky.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: The polls are now closed in Georgia, Indiana, Kentucky, South Carolina, Virginia and Vermont, and in parts of Florida and New Hampshire.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: In all seriousness, I havenâ€™t even looked at the early exit polls. Like, you all want â€™em, and I've got â€™em! And I just donâ€™t care. That's how useful I think it is.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: A lot of the Wisconsin focus tonight will be on the 23 counties that flipped from Obama to Trump. The Biden campaign and Dems here hope and expect to win a lot of them back.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Democrats in Philadelphia are growing increasingly confident, at least in their turnout. Multiple local Dems say they think they can match or exceed 2008 turnout in the city.

liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein
liveUpdates.text: Hello from Madison, where Democrats are anticipating a big Biden victory. Mandela Barnes, the lieutenant governor, told me this morning Biden would win by 7 points.

liveUpdates.author: Elaina Plott
liveUpdates.text: Many polls show Trump and Biden neck-and-neck in Ohio. Iâ€™ll be watching the handful of suburban precincts around Columbus that Trump won in 2016 â€” they could prove crucial.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: Something to keep in mind: Per TargetSmart, a Democratic data firm, almost 30% of early votes were cast by people who didnâ€™t cast a ballot in the 2016 election.

liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck
liveUpdates.text: Good evening from Wilmington, Joe Bidenâ€™s hometown, where he is watching election returns with his family, weâ€™re told. Hereâ€™s the convention center where heâ€™d speak tonight.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: Some elections experts believe the pandemic may have changed voting forever. Will the ritual of Election Day disappear?

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: What Iâ€™m watching: the margins in Philadelphia. Voters there were slow to embrace mail-in voting, so we might be able to distill some turnout numbers from the in-person vote.

liveUpdates.author: Patricia Mazzei
liveUpdates.text: Today in Florida: Republicans came out in force to vote, as expected. Democrats and independents have voted later in the day. But the overall electorate still leans Republican.

liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor
liveUpdates.text: The first polls are closing in much of Indiana and Kentucky. Polls in the western parts of both states will be open for another hour.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: An outside Republican PAC has spent more than $700,000 to unseat Bob Trammell, the Dem. leader of the Georgia House. David Jenkins, an Army veteran, is the G.O.P. candidate.

liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Casey
liveUpdates.text: What Iâ€™m watching: It would be interesting to know how many former felons were blocked from voting by Florida Republicans who required they pay court fees before voting.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper
liveUpdates.text: With more than 101.1 million early votes cast in person and by mail before the polls even opened today, this campaign is shaping up to be one for the record books.

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: Iâ€™m here in Orlando, where both sides expect a really tight race. Iâ€™ll be watching Sumter County â€” the home of the Villages, one of Americaâ€™s largest retirement communities.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: The Allegheny County executive, a Democrat, predicts Biden will win there by 150,000, nearly 50% better than Clinton did. Thatâ€™s Babe Ruth pointing to the bleachers. Letâ€™s see how it holds up.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: Itâ€™ll be hard to interpret Pennsylvania results tonight because many mail votes wonâ€™t be reported.Â But Allegheny County (Pittsburgh) says it will report mail ballots quickly.

liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti
liveUpdates.text: What Iâ€™m watching: the split in Miami-Dade County. Democrats were getting worried about early voting turnout in the Democratic stronghold as the election drew closer.

liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters
liveUpdates.text: What Iâ€™m watching: The Senate results will say a lot about how well Trump is doing in big battlegrounds. If Thom Tillis can keep it close in NC, thatâ€™s a good sign for Trump.

liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul
liveUpdates.text: What Iâ€™m watching: In Gwinnett County, Ga., the retiring Representative Rob Woodallâ€™s seat is up for grabs, and Democrats believe they might be able to flip it this year.

liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer
liveUpdates.text: What Iâ€™m watching: The race in Indianaâ€™s 5th District, a conservative Indianapolis suburb, is competitive. If Democrats win there, itâ€™s good early indicator for them.

liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Casey
liveUpdates.text: What Iâ€™m watching: A local school board race in Sumter County, Ga., will shape up to be a key test of voting rights tonight.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper
liveUpdates.text: As the polls opened today, a staggering 100.3 million ballots had already been cast, suggesting that the nation is on pace to set a record for turnout.

liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
liveUpdates.text: Tonight, the needle will be back â€” sort of. Weâ€™ll have live estimates for Florida, Georgia and North Carolina.

liveUpdates.author: Sheera Frenkel
liveUpdates.text: Times tech reporters will be monitoring for misinformation/disinformation around the vote. We are here to help debunk all the crazy that the internet will throw at you today.

liveUpdates.author: Michael Barbaro
liveUpdates.text: From 4 p.m. to 8 p.m. Eastern time, weâ€™ll be talking to Times reporters and voters across the country about a historic Election Day.

liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel
liveUpdates.text: A look at Trump and the G.O.P.â€™s closing strategy: to knock out as many votes as possible on technicalities and baseless charges of fraud.
